channel.title: 纽约时报-全球
channel.description: 这是一个追踪纽约时报-全球news的种子

item.title: 目击者描述了加沙一家医院的恐惧和匮乏场景，这家医院在过去一周里一直被以色列围困。
item.description:
Witnesses have described scenes of fear and deprivation at a Gaza hospital that has been under an Israeli siege for the past week. https://t.co/wAyNXTHfnO

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 24, 2024

item.title: 金门是台湾控制的一个小岛，距离中国海岸几英里，上个月，一艘快艇上的两名中国男子在试图逃离台湾海岸警卫队船只时在该海域丧生，此后，金门附近海域的局势再次变得紧张起来。
item.description:
The sea around Kinmen, a small island controlled by Taiwan a few miles off China’s coast, has again turned tense after two Chinese men onboard a speedboat died in the area last month while trying to flee a Taiwanese Coast Guard vessel. https://t.co/trW5Ls6WuL

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 24, 2024

item.title: 印度马哈拉施特拉邦砍甘蔗的妇女正在接受不必要的子宫切除手术，通常是为了继续工作，不受月经、怀孕或妇科检查的干扰。
item.description:
Women who cut sugar cane in the Indian state of Maharashtra are getting unnecessary hysterectomies, often as a way to keep working, undistracted by periods, pregnancies or gynecological checkups. https://t.co/SbJLZ2ibE2

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 24, 2024

item.title: 撤离行动以及黎巴嫩将数千名平民迁离边境的努力是以色列与黎巴嫩民兵和政治组织真主党之间冲突加剧的结果。
item.description:
The evacuations and an effort in Lebanon to move thousands of civilians away from the border are the result of an intensifying conflict between Israel and Hezbollah, the Lebanese militia and political organization. https://t.co/yAD406jXJr

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 24, 2024

item.title: 当全世界都在关注乌克兰和加沙的冲突时，叙利亚的小规模冲突已持续多年，ISIS 长期以来一直威胁要直接打击俄罗斯，因为俄罗斯支持叙利亚总统巴沙尔-阿萨德的政权。
item.description:
While the world was focused on the conflicts in Ukraine and Gaza, skirmishing has been simmering for years in Syria, and ISIS has long threatened to strike Russia directly for shoring up the regime of President Bashar al-Assad of Syria. https://t.co/fNP575ymuN

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 24, 2024

item.title: 教皇方济各选择在复活节周一开始时跳过这场艰苦的演讲，立即引起了人们对他健康状况的担忧，但他在演讲前后的讲话声音清晰。
item.description:
Pope Francis’ choice to skip the strenuous speech at the outset of Easter week immediately raised concerns about his health, but he spoke in a clear voice before and after it. https://t.co/tDu3fkOOsz

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 24, 2024

item.title: 在东部城市阿夫迪耶夫卡，一场争夺乌克兰士兵碉堡的战斗凸显了冲突如何越来越多地在血腥的近距离战斗中展开。
item.description:
A battle for a bunker held by Ukrainian soldiers in the eastern city of Avdiivka highlights how the conflict is increasingly being fought in bloody, close-quarter combat. https://t.co/xWoMkMUSdI

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 24, 2024

item.title: 该激进组织以阿富汗为基地，以暴力反对该国的塔利班领导人，认为他们对伊斯兰教法不够虔诚，不够极端。该组织越来越多地将矛头指向外国敌人。
item.description:
The militant group, based in Afghanistan, violently opposes the country’s Taliban leaders, viewing them as insufficiently dedicated to Shariah law and not extremist enough. It increasingly is targeting foreign foes. https://t.co/xbGiLbI2hd

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 24, 2024

item.title: 塞内加尔周日投票选举新总统，许多年轻人认为这是一次彻底改革政治和经济秩序的机会。这次选举可谓一波三折，令人目不暇接。
item.description:
Senegal votes for a new president Sunday, in an election that many young people see as a chance to overhaul the political and economic order. And it has been a nail-biting and whiplash-inducing run-up. https://t.co/Yn5eVz7p62

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 24, 2024

item.title: 尼日利亚官员周日表示，本月早些时候被绑架的数十名尼日利亚学童已经获释。
item.description:
Dozens of Nigerian schoolchildren who were kidnapped earlier this month have been freed, officials said on Sunday. https://t.co/TQhV4S5nWo

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 24, 2024

item.title: 在就莫斯科音乐厅袭击事件发表的首次讲话中，普京总统为指责乌克兰奠定了基础。美国官员评估认为，ISIS 的一个分支应对此负责，并对普京可能寻求将责任归咎于乌克兰表示担忧。
item.description:
In his first remarks on the Moscow concert hall attack, President Vladimir Putin laid the groundwork for blaming Ukraine. U.S. officials have assessed that a branch of ISIS was responsible, and voiced concern that Putin could seek to blame Ukraine. https://t.co/ChR0O3cVxK

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 23, 2024

item.title: 委内瑞拉陷入困境的反对派周五宣布，将在今年夏天提名一位新候选人与总统尼古拉斯-马杜罗对决，这为该国推动民主进程带来了新的希望。
item.description:
Venezuela’s embattled opposition announced Friday it was naming a new candidate to face off against President Nicolas Maduro this summer, giving renewed hope to the country’s push toward democracy. https://t.co/BwkdDBwsEy

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 23, 2024

item.title: 在紧急救援人员对莫斯科音乐厅袭击现场进行清查时，一些官员和当地新闻媒体开始透露一些遇难者的详细情况。
item.description:
As emergency services combed the scene of the attack on a concert hall in Moscow, details on some of the victims began to emerge from officials and local news media. https://t.co/tw2Hal6DGm

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 23, 2024

item.title: 新闻分析：莫斯科郊外发生的悲剧是对这位在大选中取得阶段性胜利仅几天后就信心满满的领导人的沉重打击。
item.description:
News Analysis: The tragedy outside Moscow is a blow to a leader riding an aura of confidence only days after a stage-managed election victory. https://t.co/PDuGK1L521

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 23, 2024

item.title: 美国官员称，ISIS 附属组织是莫斯科致命袭击的幕后黑手，也是塔利班政府在阿富汗面临的最后一个重要对手之一。
item.description:
The ISIS affiliate that American officials say was behind the deadly attack in Moscow is one of the last significant antagonists that the Taliban government faces in Afghanistan. https://t.co/4PgSS51w9x

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 23, 2024

item.title: "他们知道自己无法控制网络世界，"一位王室专家在谈到最近有关凯瑟琳和国王查尔斯三世健康状况的一系列爆料时说。
item.description:

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 23, 2024

item.title: 联合国秘书长安东尼奥-古特雷斯（António Guterres）周六再次呼吁立即在加沙实行人道主义停火，并在访问埃及边境口岸时抨击了巴勒斯坦人在该地区面临的 "无休止的噩梦"。
item.description:
António Guterres, the U.N. secretary general, reiterated his call on Saturday for an immediate humanitarian cease-fire in Gaza, using a visit to a border crossing in Egypt to slam the “nonstop nightmare” Palestinians faced in the territory. https://t.co/hTozYaCIWL

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 23, 2024

item.title: 在宣布威尔士王妃凯瑟琳正在接受癌症治疗的第二天早上，伦敦的人们对她表示同情，并祝愿她一切安好。
item.description:
The morning after it was announced that Catherine, Princess of Wales, was being treated for cancer, people in London expressed sympathy for her and wished her well. https://t.co/sIzfMu8lzG

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 23, 2024

item.title: 对许多俄罗斯人来说，周五晚在莫斯科郊区一个音乐厅发生的大屠杀让他们想起了近几十年来发生在全国各地的枪击和爆炸事件，这些事件通常被当局称为恐怖主义。
item.description:
For many Russians, the massacre at a concert hall on the outskirts of Moscow on Friday night brought to mind shootings and bombings across the country in recent decades, events that the authorities often described as terrorism. https://t.co/dqrVQQB9dF

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 23, 2024

item.title: 威尔士王妃凯瑟琳说，她的癌症是在腹部手术后发现的，她正在接受 "预防性化疗"。以下是我们了解到的情况。
item.description:
Catherine, Princess of Wales, said that her cancer had been discovered after abdominal surgery and that she was receiving “preventative chemotherapy.” Here’s what we know. https://t.co/Rj3MLysuox

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 23, 2024

item.title: 据国家通讯社报道，俄罗斯最高安全机构称，枪手周五袭击了莫斯科的一个音乐会场馆，造成至少40人死亡，100多人受伤。图片显示了可能是俄罗斯数十年来最致命袭击的现场。
item.description:
Gunmen stormed a Moscow concert venue on Friday, killing at least 40 people and wounding more than 100, Russia’s top security agency said, according to state news agencies. Images show the scene of what could be the deadliest attack in Russia in decades. https://t.co/MZSHIx1jq9

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 23, 2024

item.title: 随着大选的临近，印度总理纳伦德拉-莫迪与反对党控制的各邦之间的政治纷争正在给维系印度的联邦模式带来压力。
item.description:
As an election nears, political strife between Prime Minister Narendra Modi and opposition-held states is straining the federal formula that holds India together. https://t.co/MKRa1RZCH3

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 23, 2024

item.title: 罗伯特-L.-巴里（Robert L. Barry）是美国武器协议的首席谈判代表，美国官员认为该协议对冷战即将结束时缓和东西方紧张局势非常重要。他已去世，享年 89 岁。
item.description:
Robert L. Barry was the chief U.S. negotiator for an arms accord that American officials considered important in reducing East-West tensions near the end of the Cold War. He has died at 89. https://t.co/qDXazsdivk

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 22, 2024

item.title: 在过去两年里，"The Rest is Politics "的政治履历和节目的中间派倾向使其成为英国最受欢迎的播客之一。
item.description:
Over the last two years, the political résumés and the show’s centrist leanings have made “The Rest is Politics” one of the most popular podcasts in Britain. https://t.co/JFDh61CSaK

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 22, 2024

item.title: 以色列制琴师阿姆农-温斯坦（Amnon Weinstein）去世，享年 84 岁。他修复了大屠杀期间属于犹太人的小提琴，使世界各地的音乐家能够演奏这些小提琴，以充满希望的旋律向那些在纳粹死亡集中营中沉默的人们致敬。
item.description:
Amnon Weinstein, an Israeli luthier who restored violins belonging to Jews during the Holocaust so musicians around the world could play them in hopeful, melodic tributes to those silenced in Nazi death camps, has died at 84. https://t.co/JPE8ikNZGT

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 22, 2024

item.title: 即时新闻：据俄罗斯国家通讯社报道，枪手在莫斯科郊外一个受欢迎的音乐会场开火。

item.title: 瑞典法院一直在辩论对一块坠落在斯德哥尔摩北部的陨石的索赔问题，包括在大自然中（包括在私有财产上）活动的权利是否延伸到对陨石的索赔。
item.description:
Sweden’s courts have been debating claims to a meteorite that fell north of Stockholm, including whether the right to move around in nature, including on private property, extends to claiming a meteorite. https://t.co/bnl05f8lFr

item.title: 佛罗里达州的一对夫妇前往多米尼加共和国参加婚礼，他们把两岁的儿子寄放在邻国海地的亲戚家，结果孩子却被该国日益严重的动乱困住了。
item.description:
A trip by a Florida couple to the Dominican Republic to attend a wedding turned into days of anxiety after they dropped off their 2-year-old son with relatives in neighboring Haiti and the boy ended up trapped by that country’s worsening upheaval. https://t.co/g7cKRksLhK
